content.title: Long-term Outcomes After Coarctation Repair
content.description: Late complications and surveillance after aortic coarctation repair

key_concepts.details: Recurrent stenosis occurs in 5-15% depending on repair type and age at surgery
Hypertension persists or develops in 30-75% despite successful repair
Late aneurysms at repair site or associated intracranial aneurysms; require surveillance
Bicuspid aortic valve (50-85%), intracranial aneurysms (10%), ascending aortic dilation

content.clinical_significance: Lifelong surveillance required even after successful repair
